Scorching Fists (Very Rare).name: Scorching Fists (Very Rare)
Scorching Fists (Very Rare).description:
Wondrous item, very rare

Made of ceramic and metal plating, these gloves allow their wearer to smelt, weld, and otherwise manipulate metal without fear of burning oneself. In underground battle pits, these gloves see more unconventional uses: with the limiters removed, the glove's knuckle-exhausts can form blades of devastating flame.

While wearing these gloves, you can handle white-hot metal without fear of burning yourself. This item has 10 charges. Over the course of 1 minute, you can fill the gloves' fuel canisters with 10 gp of high quality oil, causing it to regain [[/r 1d8 + 2]] expended charges. Once this item regains charges, it can't regain charges again until the next dawn.

Scorching Fist. While wearing this item, you can expend 1 charge (no action required) to deal an additional [[/r 3d4]] fire damage whenever you hit with an unarmed strike with your fist on your turn.

Overheat. As an action, you can expend 3 charges to remove the gloves' limiter, causing a flaming blade to blossom from each one. The gloves shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. These blades last for 1 minute or until you extinguish them (no action required). They are simple melee weapons with the finesse and light properties, with which you are proficient. Each deals [[/r 3d10]] fire damage on a hit.

Martial weapon, melee weapon 2 lb. [[/r 1d8]] piercing - finesse

This item has 6 charges and regains [[/r 1d4 + 2]] expended charges daily at dawn.

Arcanodynamo. While holding this weapon, you can cause it to regain expended charges by swinging it vigorously for 10 minutes without interruption. At the end of this time, make a DC 10 Strength (Athletics) check. The item regains [[/r 1d6]] expended charges on a successful check, or half as many charges on a failed one. Lightning Blade. As a bonus action while holding this sword, you can pull the trigger 1, 2, or 3 clicks, energising the blade for 1 minute as described below:

  • 1 Click. You expend 1 charge. For the duration, each time you hit with an attack using this weapon, you deal an extra [[/r 1d8]] lightning damage.

  • 2 Clicks. You expend 3 charges. For the duration, each time you hit with an attack using this weapon, you deal an extra [[/r 1d10]] lightning damage.   • 3 Clicks. You expend 6 charges. For the duration, each time you hit with an attack using this weapon, you deal an extra [[/r 1d12]] lightning damage. Clockwork Wyvern.description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

This limited edition clockwork wyvern comes with a fully operational, miniature coal engine. Thanks to an intricate mix of steam-powered gears and pistons, the construct has lifelike movements and mannerisms. Unlike its nonmagical cousins, this particular specimen gains a degree of self-awareness when a creature attunes to it.

In combat, the @Compendium[larsene-ledger-treasures-and-trinkets.loot-tavern-06-magitech-mayhem-item.9k8zE46wOSgq83lR]{Clockwork Wyvern} shares your initiative count, but takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take an action in its stat block or the Dash, Disengage, Help, Hide, or Search action. The wyvern has 6 charges; see the wyvern's stat block for details on how it can expend and recharge this resource.

Death and Damage. If the clockwork wyvern is reduced to 0 hit points, it loses all charges and becomes inert. A wyvern that has 0 hit points regains 1 hit point when it takes lightning damage from a spell of 1st level or higher, or if 2 gp of charcoal is placed in its chest-furnace. The clockwork wyvern regains [[/r 2d6]] hit points each time the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.kjmjY0zlE6IEiQVL]{Mending} cantrip is cast on it. Except for these two means, a wyvern can't regain hit points.

Martial weapon, melee weapon 4 lb.
[[/r 1d8]] slashing - versatile ([[/r 1d10]])

A rudimentary firearm, this item has been modified and mounted with an axe head fashioned from scrap metal. Remnants of oak wood on the handle and the firing mechanism are all that is left from the original firearm. The result is a magical axe-blunderbuss hybrid that can only be used at point blank range due to its poor precision and limited blast power.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

Light armor, uncommon (requires attunement)
8 lb. AC 11 + Dex

This mechanical garb was tailor-made to allow assassins to glide over their target without being heard, before eliminating them with a swift, swooping attack. Anton Spark, the famous tinkerer, modelled this design after a snowy owl silently snatched a doughnut from his hand.

Shadowglide. Whenever you fall from a height of 10 feet or more while wearing this armour, you can use a reaction to glide. While gliding, you move 1 foot horizontally for each 1 foot you fall, take no falling damage when you land, and have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to move silently. Once this property of the armour has been used, it can’t be used again until the next dawn.

Take-Off. As a bonus action, you can activate your wings and gain a flying speed of 30 feet for 10 minutes. Once this property of the armour has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

If you make a melee weapon attack against a creature immediately after moving in this way and hit, the attack deals an extra [[/r 1d6]] damage for every 10 feet you moved, and you can immediately move another 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. If the attack misses, you crash, taking [[/r 1d6]] bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet you moved and landing prone.

The wearer has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

Privateer Coat (Rare).description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

Worn to shield airship crewmates against cold and violent winds, this jacket is equipped with pockets and pouches fit for repair tools and weapons. Some coats are adorned with decorative shoulder pads and pins to distinguish rank and aerial prowess.

Built for the Skies. While wearing this coat, you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to overcome the effects of cold weather or violent winds. You also have advantage on saving throws against effects that deal cold damage. Finally, you have advantage on Charisma checks against any creature that perceives itself to be below the rank indicated by the coat. When you find this coat, roll a [[/r d4]] to determine its rank:

[[/r d4]]Rank
1Petty officer
2Lieutenant
3Captain
4Admiral

Repair Adept. While wearing this coat, you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.kjmjY0zlE6IEiQVL]{Mending} cantrip at will.

Aerial Messaging. While wearing this coat, you can write a message in the sky, creating one letter out of clouds every 30 seconds. The letters last for 1 hour on a calm day, 10 minutes in a moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour), or 1 minute in a strong wind (at least 20 miles per hour). Once this property of the coat has been used, you can't use it again until the next dawn, unless you are operating aircraft.

Technomancer Staff (Rare).description:
Weapon (@Compendium[dnd5e.items.g2dWN7PQiMRYWzyk]{Quarterstaff}), rare (requires attunement)

Simple weapon, melee weapon 4 lb. [[/r 1d6]] bludgeoning - versatile ([[/r 1d8]])

A focus for pliers of electrical currents and lightning-based magic, this staff represents the evolution of wizardcraft and artifice. While old-fashioned mages potter about with candles and arcane runes, the new blood embraces technology. This staff contains the latest in magic energy catalysts, allowing it to recycle and redirect residual magical energy.

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Whenever you cast a spell that deals lightning damage while holding this quarterstaff, roll a [[/r d10]] and add the result to one lightning damage roll of that spell against one of its targets.

Lightning Rod. When you or a creature within 20 feet of you takes lightning damage, you can use your reaction to reduce that damage by [[/r 3d10]] + your proficiency bonus as the staff absorbs the energy.

Residual Charge. After you cast a spell that deals lightning damage or use the Lightning Rod property, purple crackling energy gathers at the tip of this quarterstaff. The next time you hit with a melee attack using this weapon within the next minute, you deal an additional [[/r 1d10]] lightning damage to the target.

Versatile. This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property—the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.

Heavy Mobile Drill (Rare).name: Heavy Mobile Drill (Rare)
Heavy Mobile Drill (Rare).description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

A wonder of mining technology, this drill can turn even the most meagre gnome into a walking excavator.

While wearing this item, you can't jump. However, you can use the drill arm to raise you up to 10 feet off of the ground (no action required). You can't use the drill's properties while raised.

Weapon. While wearing this item, you can use it as a simple melee weapon that doesn't require the use of your hands. You are proficient with this weapon, which deals [[/r 1d10]] piercing damage on a hit. You have advantage on melee attack rolls made with the drill against creatures made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal, and it deals double damage to structures.

Excavate. As an action, you can choose a portion of non magical soil, sand, or rock within 5 feet of you that fits within a 10-foot cube and excavate it, depositing it up to 10 feet away.

Drill! As an action, you can make a melee attack with the drill against a creature within 10 feet of you. On a hit, you deal piercing damage equal to [[/r 3d10]] + your Strength modifier. If the creature is wearing armour made of an inorganic substance such as stone, crystal, or metal, its armour takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to its AC. The armour is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

Power. The crystals that power this device are temperamental, often discharging when too much power is drawn. Whenever you use the Drill! property, roll a [[/r d4]]. On a 1, the crystals go dark and the drill becomes a dead weight; while wearing it, you can't use it as a weapon, use any of its properties, and your walking speed is halved. The crystals must take 10 lightning or radiant damage in order to recharge and resume normal function.

Unfortunately for rakin, this isn't an exaggeration: giant owls are the number one predators of forest-dwelling tanukin. If the creature emits heat (GM's discretion), you have advantage on Perception checks that rely on sight made to detect it, and you can always see it regardless of light conditions, obscurement, invisibility, or cover, but this vision is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.
